clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot of Mindfulness Therapy for Inpatients With Gastro-intestinal Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Exploratory Study of Mindfulness for Inpatients With Chronic Gastrointestinal Pain: Does it Reduce Pain Related Distress and Increase Confidence in Pain Self-management?

brief_summary.textblock:
Research questions/hypotheses
1. Can an individual mindfulness intervention for Gastro Intestinal Failure inpatients reduce pain-related distress, improve quality of life, and increase confidence in pain self-management?
2. How useful and applicable do Gastro Intestinal Failure inpatients find Mindfulness methods?

primary_outcome.measure: Change in pain distress rating on 11 point numerical rating scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, week 1, week 2, week 3, week 4, week 5 , week 6, week 7, week 8
primary_outcome.description: A numerical rating scale scored from 0 to 10 which asks "how distressing is the pain on average in the last week with 0 being not distressing at all and 10 being extreme distress"

secondary_outcome.description: a 10 item scale that attempts to capture a measure of individual's confidence in being active despite pain, rated on a numerical scale from 0 "not at all confident" to 6 "completely confident"
a 20 item measure included to provide a rating of acceptance of pain
a 39 item questionnaire which has been developed from five mindfulness questionnaires using exploratory factor analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Self-report record of using mindfulness exercises (frequency and duration)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 1, week 2, week 3, week 4, week 5, week 6, week 7, week 8

secondary_outcome.measure: Brief account of experience of pain and doing the mindfulness exercises
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 1, week 2, week 3, week 4, week 5, week 6, week 7, week 8
secondary_outcome.description: participants will be asked to write a brief (<1 page) account of their experience of their pain and of doing the mindfulness exercises over the preceding week

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in pain intensity rating on 11 point numerical rating scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, week 1, week 2, week 3, week 4, week 5 , week 6, week 7, week 8
secondary_outcome.description: A numerical rating scale scored from 0 to 10 which asks "how intense is the pain on average in the last week with 0 being no pain and 10 being extreme pain"

intervention.description: Mindfulness is a psychological intervention based on increasing skills of non-judgemental awareness using meditations. In this study a self-directed 8 week course of mindfulness will be used involving self-help materials in the form of a book and 8 guided meditations on audio files.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- >18 years, pain experienced
- >3 months, proficiency in English
Exclusion Criteria:
- previous mindfulness experience
- severe cognitive impairment
- profound hearing difficulties
